result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew P. Schindler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Matthew P. Schindler is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Matthew P. Schindler was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Sauk County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment/evaluations per agent.  Not to possess controlled substances w/o valid prescription and must notify agent w/in two working days if one is received.  Absolute Sobriety.  ALL COURT ORDERED OBLIGATIONS TO BE PAID THROUGH CLERK OF COURTS

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew P. Schindler

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DE to serve 60 days conditional jail time w/work & treatment release.

Defendant Matthew P. Schindler in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and State states case and appearances and recommendations.  Atty Middleton agrees and NC pleas entered.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts/finds guilty.  Parties have reviewed VIS.  State makes further statement re: victim notification and recs.  Atty Middleton makes statement on behalf of DE.  DE makes statement on his own behalf.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  

15CM460
Ct 1:  NC

16CM56
Ct 2:  NC
Cts 1 and 3:  Dismissed

Probation for 24 months on each concurrent to each other
Conditions of probation:
120 days jail w/huber but w/o good time on 15CM460 ONLY
To commence on or before 4/8/2016 at 7:30 pm 
$443.00 and $543.00 costs to be paid to Clerk of Courts Office TODAY or set up payment plan
Cash bond to be applied
DNA sample to be provided
Restitution of $1,689.34 to Crime Victim's Compensation plus all applicable surcharges to be paid TODAY or set up payment plan w/Clerk of Courts Office
AODA/Treatment/Counseling/Evaluations all per agent
Absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances w/o valid prescription
Must notify agent w/in two working days if a prescription is received
DE to report to P&P after court today
No contact w/A.W. or her residence or her children.  May return to residence one time upon prior notice and w/law enforcement to retrieve belongings.

Pre-trial conference at 03-11-2016 11:00 am.
Return date at 03-24-2016 01:00 pm.

Defendant Matthew P. Schindler by video from LEC with attorney Puck Tsai.  Defendant Matthew P. Schindler in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  State requests $150 cash bond.  Atty Tsai responds.  Advised rights to an attorney.  File set for pre-trial conference/return date.  $250.00 signature bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact w/A.W. or her residence or her child.  May go to residence one time upon prior notice and w/law enforcement to retrieve belongings if necessary.  Don't know if DE qualifies or not yet.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 11, 2016 at 11:00 am.  Return date scheduled for March 24, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
